results.title: Flying over mother
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Melanie Coombs and Michael James Rowland
results.brief_description:
1. Vladimir is growing up on an isolated farm somewhere on the Russian Steppes. He has been brought up on his mother’s stories of all the dangers that lie in wait for boys who misbehave and he is trying - not very successfully - to overcome his fears. But one day something happens that will change the direction of his life.
  2. Vladimir has finally reached his goal - he has trained as a cosmonaut and is circling the earth. But unfortunately his capsule has malfunctioned and things don’t look so good for him…

results.title: Reilly: ace of spies: an affair with a married woman
results.creator_credit: Jim Goddard, Chris Burt and Euston Films
results.brief_description: Sidney Reilly, said to have been the inspiration for James Bond, was probably the greatest spy the world has ever known. A rogue, womaniser, and brilliant tactician, he thrived on danger, performing extraordinary feats that changed the course of history. Reilly’s first mission involves undertaking a dangerous journey to Baku to investigate the Russian search for oil in the Middle East. Stars Sam Neill and Leo McKern.

results.title: Red Nightmare
results.creator_credit: George Waggner, William L. Hendricks, United States. Dept. of Defense and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: An anti communist drama sponsored by the U.S Government, supervised by Jack L. Warner and produced during the Cold War. The drama revolves around a small town American who takes his civil liberties for granted until he dreams of a communist takeover which jolts him out of his complacency. Narrated by Jack Webb. Photographed by Robert Hoffman. Written by Vincent Fotre. Music by William Lava. Edited by Folmer Blargsted. Starring Jack Kelly, Jeanne Cooper, Andrew Duggan, Peter Brown, Patricia Woodell, Peter Breck, Robert Conrad, Mike Road.

results.title: Red firecracker, green firecracker [DVD] = Pao da shuang deng
results.creator_credit: He Ping, Yung Naiming, Chan Chun-Keung and Yung and Associates
results.brief_description: Cai Chunzhi’s (Jing Ning) family own a prosperous firecracker factory on the banks of the Yellow River in Northern China. When her father dies, because she is the only child she inherits the factory and becomes “Master”. She dresses like a man and everyone addresses her as “Master” but as a woman, her hold on power is tenuous and she carefully respects the authority of the factory head, Man Dihong. When she hires an artist to paint door gods for the Chinese New Year her life is turned upside down. Niu Bao is a handsome young painter whose pride and headstrong nature put him on a collision course with Dihong, as Bao and his ‘master’ struggle with their attraction to each other. Winner of 3 Golden Rooster Awards (the Chinese equivalent of the Oscars). Based on the novel by Feng Jicai.
results.title_for_label: Red firecracker, green firecracker [DVD] = Pao da shuang deng

results.title: Rehearsal
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Much of the work of an orchestra and its conductor is done in shirt sleeves, in an empty hall. In this film we go behind the scenes with conductor Paul Scherman as he prepares a Montreal orchestra for a performance of a new composition by Canadian composer Harry Somers. Mr. Somers himself is on hand to hear this rehearsal of his Suite for Harp and Chamber Orchestra.

results.title: Refugee talks
results.brief_description:
Andrea Lange is a Norwegian artist whose work reflects the increasing dynamism of
Scandinavian multimedia art. Lange’s media include video, sculpture and film, and her work is imbued with both a playful sense of popular culture as well as a focus on the contemporary political challenges confronting Europe. ‘Refugee Talks’ was featured in the 1999 Melbourne International Biennial, Signs of Life, and was one of the most discussed and controversial works in the exhibition.

To make ‘Refugee Talks’, Andrea Lange took her video camera to a reception centre for refugees in Norway. Awaiting confirmation or denial of their residency applications, the refugees ‘speak’ this state of ‘becoming’ through the medium of music. They sing songs that evoke origin and a sense of place, songs and lamentations in their own languages. Sometimes, however, they sing to us in accents and expressions that are more familiar to us in the West: two young girls dance to the Spice Girls and declare that, If you wanna be my lover, you gotta get with my friends.

Exhibited at life-size scale, ‘Refugee Talks’ asks us to listen directly to these contemporary ‘psalms’, to look into the eyes of the singers and to sense the remembered worlds they are carrying with them - even as the bureaucratic politics of their lives in the camps is presently regulating, like an old metronome, all the vibrancy they have to offer.

results.title: Refuge England
results.creator_credit: Robert Vas, Laszlo Marton and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: A study in the loneliness of a stranger confronted with the vastness of a foreign city. A first impression of London is captured with a fresh, eager eye, and the gradual realisation of their lack of concern is beautifully established in a series of encounters with a newspaper seller, a policeman, and most effectively of all, a man mowing his lawn in a suburban street.

results.title: Refinishing furniture
results.brief_description: Bob Flexner provides a working knowledge of the practical and decorative aspects of refinishing furniture, indicating when to rejuvenate an old finish, how to remove a finish that has failed and how to refurnish fine furniture. This informative video covers ‘Reviving furniture’, ‘Stripping’, ‘Sealing and filling’, ‘Glazing’, ‘Finishing with oil, varnish, shellac and lacquer’ and how to ‘Adjust and repair finishes’.

results.title: Reedy river
results.creator_credit: ABC, Keith Gow, Peter Hamilton and Peter Hamilton Productions
results.brief_description: Lawson’s poem is dramatised and set to music in a pastoral setting. Describes the hardships and joys of settling in virgin country, and for the settler, the greatest hardship of all, the loss of his beautiful wife. Uses flashback technique. Enacted by Jock Levy and Sylvia Salisbury while the words are sung by Alex Hood, Barbara Lysiak and the Ramblers.

results.title: Redfern Beach (D)
results.creator_credit: Catriona McKenzie, Yvonne Maden, Rachel Roberts and AFTRS
results.brief_description: An islander Max (Michael Huahihe) finds himself working at a fish processing plant and struggles to be accepted. Unsure of the violent lifestyle, he attempts to move on once given perspective when befriended by Harry (Tony Barry), a local fisherman and his new lover, Phaedra.
